H0.text: Nuclear energy is an alternative energy resource that adds carbon dioxide to the atmosphere.

H1.text: Biofuel energy adds carbon dioxide to the atmosphere.

H2.text: Wind energy is an alternative energy resource that adds carbon dioxide to the atmosphere.

H3.text: Geothermal energy is an alternative energy resource that adds carbon dioxide to the atmosphere.

A4.text: Biofuels emit fewer greenhouse gas emissions when burned in an engine and are generally considered carbon-neutral fuels.

A5.text: burning wood for energy releases carbon dioxide.

A6.text: Life-cycle GHG emissions of modern bioenergy alternatives are usually lower than those for fossil fuels.

A7.text: Carbon dioxide is a by-product of the fermentation of sugar in the brewing of beer, whisky and other alcoholic beverages and in the production of bioethanol.

A8.text: Some non-renewable sources of energy, such as nuclear power, generate almost no emissions.

A9.text: Some renewable energy sources can be very carbon-intensive, such as the burning of biomass if it is not offset by planting new plants.
